intro: Boerhavia lindheimeri, commonly known as Lindheimer's bluestem, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Boerhavia lindheimeri is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
